text: Air/vapor barrier type approved and as per submittals
Membrane product within expiry date, undamaged, stored per manufacturer recommendations
Flashing tape, primers, sealants approved and compatible
Substrate clean, dry, and free of sharp edges, moisture, and debris
Framing/sheathing securely fastened and joints tight
Barrier applied continuous with no voids, fish mouths, or wrinkles
Shingle lap method followed at overlaps (min. 3” horizontal, 6” vertical)
Seams sealed with compatible tape or adhesive
Corner transitions detailed with membrane wrap
Mechanical penetrations (pipes, vents) fully sealed and gasketed
Electrical, MEP penetrations sealed with sleeves, tape, or flashing
Rough openings (windows/doors) wrapped in full pan flashing, jamb and head detailing
Flashing extends over sheathing, and not behind it
Transition between wall and roof or floor decks sealed
QA/QC visual inspection and testing (adhesion, pull test if required) completed

id: • CSA A440.4 / A123.3 / A500 – Air Barrier, Membrane, and Flashing Standards
